FuncDef:
The telnet server enable command enables the Telnet service.
The undo telnet server enable command disables the Telnet service.
If the default configuration file is used, the Telnet service is disabled. If the undo telnet server enable command does not exist in the configuration file, the Telnet service is enabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can run the telnet server enable command to enable the Telnet service. A client can connect to a remote server by Telnet only after the Telnet service is enabled on the server.
The telnet server enable command enables both IPv4 and IPv6 Telnet services on the server.
After you disable the Telnet service on the server, all clients that have logged in through Telnet are disconnected.
Precautions
Telnet is an insecure protocol. It is recommended that STelnet be used.
